member.summary: The output TIN to be created. (Out, Required)

member.summary: The spatial reference of the TIN to be created. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTin.in_features
member.summary: Add references to one or more feature classes that will be included in the TIN. For each feature class you'll need to set properties that indicate how it's used to define the surface. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.CreateTin.constrained_delaunay
member.summary: A constrained Delaunay triangulation conforms to Delaunay rules everywhere except along breaklines. When using conforming Delaunay triangulation, breaklines are densified by the software, therefore one input breakline segment can result in multiple triangle edges. When using constrained Delaunay triangulation no densication occurs and each breakline segment is added as a single edge. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape
member.summary: This tool interpolates z-values for a feature class based on an underlying raster, triangulated irregular network (TIN), or terrain dataset surface.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input raster, TIN, or terrain surface to be used as a source of z-values. (In, Required)
The input 2D feature class. (In, Required)
The output feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.in_surface
member.summary: The input raster, TIN, or terrain surface to be used as a source of z-values. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.in_feature_class
member.summary: The input 2D feature class. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.sample_distance
member.summary: The spacing at which z-values will be interpolated. By default, this is a raster's cell size or a TIN's natural densification. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.z_factor
member.summary: The factor by which the heights of the input surface will be multiplied to calculate new heights in the output feature class. It is used for converting z-units to match x,y units. The Z factor parameter only affects results for rasters and TINs, not terrain datasets. To apply a factor to features made from a terrain dataset use the Adjust 3D Z geoprocessing tool. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.method
member.summary: Interpolation method used to define the Z values for the input features. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.vertices_only
member.summary: The sample distance will be ignored and the interpolation will use the input vertex locations only. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.InterpolateShape.pyramid_level_resolution
member.summary: The resolution of the terrain dataset pyramid level to use for geoprocessing. The default is 0, full resolution. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight
member.summary: This tool uses an input 2D or 3D polyline feature class along with a raster, triangulated irregular network (TIN), or terrain dataset surface to determine visibility between observer and target points. A multipatch feature class can optionally be supplied to participate in the visibility analysis.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input raster, TIN, or terrain surface on which calculations are based. (In, Required)
The input polyline feature class along which visibility is calculated. This can be a 2D or 3D feature class. (In, Required)

The output line feature class along which visibility has been determined. Two attribute fields are created. VisCode indicates visibility along the line, 1 being visible and 2 not visible. TarIsVis indicates the target visibility, 0 being not visible and 1 being visible. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.in_surface
member.summary: The input raster, TIN, or terrain surface on which calculations are based. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.in_line_feature_class
member.summary: The input polyline feature class along which visibility is calculated. This can be a 2D or 3D feature class. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.out_los_feature_class
member.summary: The output line feature class along which visibility has been determined. Two attribute fields are created. VisCode indicates visibility along the line, 1 being visible and 2 not visible. TarIsVis indicates the target visibility, 0 being not visible and 1 being visible. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.out_obstruction_feature_class
member.summary: The output point feature class indicating the first obstruction point along the line of sight if the target is not visible. (Out, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.use_curvature
member.summary: (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.use_refraction
member.summary: Indicates whether atmospheric refraction should be taken into consideration when generating a line of sight from a functional surface. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.refraction_factor
member.summary: Provides a value to be used in the refraction factor. The default refraction factor is 0.13. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.pyramid_level_resolution
member.summary: The resolution of the terrain dataset pyramid level to use for geoprocessing. The default is 0, full resolution. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.LineOfSight.in_features
member.summary: A feature class of multipatches which may obstruct the line(s) of sight. Default is blank. (In, Optional)

member.summary: The directory of this tool's toolbox.

member.summary: The name of this tool's toolbox.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.DelineateTinDataArea
member.summary: Defines the data area, or interpolation zone, of a TIN based on triangle edge length.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.DelineateTinDataArea.#ctor(System.Object,System.Double)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input TIN. (In, Required)

Triangles with at least one edge that exceeds <max_edge_length> will be masked out as NODATA. These triangles will not be rendered in maps and will not be used in surface analysis such as interpolation. Length is the 2D distance. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.DelineateTinDataArea.in_tin
member.summary: The input TIN. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.DelineateTinDataArea.max_edge_length
member.summary: Triangles with at least one edge that exceeds <max_edge_length> will be masked out as NODATA. These triangles will not be rendered in maps and will not be used in surface analysis such as interpolation. Length is the 2D distance. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.DelineateTinDataArea.method
member.summary: The method used when processing triangles. PERIMETER_ONLY will iterate through triangles from the TIN's outer extent inward and will stop when the current iteration of boundary triangle edges don't exceed the Maximum Edge Length. ALL will classify the entire collection of TIN triangles by edge length. The default is PERIMETER_ONLY. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output TIN (out, Optional)

member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.

The generalized output TIN. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.BuildTerrain.update_extent
member.summary: Update Extent is used to recalculate the data extent for a window size based terrain dataset when the data area has been reduced through editing. It is not needed if the data extent has increased or if the terrain dataset is z-tolerance based. It will scan through all the terrain data to determine the new extent. member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel
member.summary: Adds new pyramid level(s) to an existing terrain dataset.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The terrain to which you want to add a pyramid level. (In, Required)

The z-tolerance or window size and reference scale of one or more pyramid levels that will be added to the terrain. The values are given in space delimited pairs; one pair for each level. The pyramid type (z-tolerance or window size) can be specified as a floating point value. The reference scale must be provided as a whole number (e.g., a value of 24000 represents a scale of 1:24000). (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.in_terrain
member.summary: The terrain to which you want to add a pyramid level. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.pyramid_type
member.summary: The type of pyramid methodology. This parameter has no value with ArcGIS 9.3 and beyond and may be omitted. The purpose of this parameter is to ensure compatibility with scripts and models written using ArcGIS 9.2. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.AddTerrainPyramidLevel.pyramid_level_definition
member.summary: The z-tolerance or window size and reference scale of one or more pyramid levels that will be added to the terrain. The values are given in space delimited pairs; one pair for each level. The pyramid type (z-tolerance or window size) can be specified as a floating point value. The reference scale must be provided as a whole number (e.g., a value of 24000 represents a scale of 1:24000). (In, Required)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline
member.summary: Generates a line or multipatch feature class containing the results from a skyline silhouette analysis. The analysis is conducted from observer points above a functional or virtual surface and will also consider features that are encountered during the analysis. When used in conjunction with other tools, especially the Skyline Barrier tool, shadow volumes and other such features can be created.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The 3D points representing observers; a separate skyline is generated for each. (In, Required)
The line feature class into which the skyline(s) will be placed. Alternatively, this could be a multipatch feature class to contain feature silhouettes. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.in_observer_point_features
member.summary: The 3D points representing observers; a separate skyline is generated for each. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.out_feature_class
member.summary: The line feature class into which the skyline(s) will be placed. Alternatively, this could be a multipatch feature class to contain feature silhouettes. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.in_surface
member.summary: The functional surface for determining the horizon. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.virtual_surface_radius
member.summary: The radius of the virtual surface for defining the horizon in lieu of an actual surface. Must be a positive value. Ignored if an actual surface is provided. The default is 1000. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.virtual_surface_elevation
member.summary: The elevation of the virtual surface for defining the horizon in lieu of an actual surface. Ignored if an actual surface is provided. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.in_features
member.summary: The feature class to use in the skyline analysis. The features typically represent obstructions such as city buildings. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.feature_lod
member.summary: The level of detail at which each feature should be examined in the skyline analysis. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.from_azimuth_value_or_field
member.summary: The azimuth, in degrees, from which the skyline analysis should be started. The analysis starts from the observer point and goes to the right, from the From Azimuth until the To Azimuth is reached. Must be greater than minus 360 and less than 360. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.to_azimuth_value_or_field
member.summary: The direction, in degrees, at which the skyline analysis should be completed. The analysis starts from the observer point and goes to the right, from the From Azimuth until the To Azimuth is reached. Must be no more than 360 greater than the From Azimuth. The default is 360. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.azimuth_increment_value_or_field
member.summary: The angular interval, in degrees, at which the horizon should be evaluated while conducting the skyline analysis between the From Azimuth and the To Azimuth. Must be no greater than the To Azimuth minus the From Azimuth. The default is 1. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.max_horizon_radius
member.summary: The maximum distance for which a horizon should be sought from the observer location. A value of zero indicates that there should be no limit imposed. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.segment_skyline
member.summary: Instead of one only one line being generated to represent the skyline from each observer point, the output is split into multiple lines. Each of these lines represents a different feature, or a stretch of horizon between features. If silhouettes are being generated, then this parameter will indicate whether divergent rays should be used; for sun shadows this should generally be no or unchecked. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.scale_to_percent
member.summary: Indicates to what percent of the original vertical angle (angle above the horizon, or angle of elevation) or elevation each skyline vertex should be placed. If either 0 or 100 is entered then no scaling will occur. The default is 100. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.scale_according_to
member.summary: The values according to which the scaling should be determined. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.scale_method
member.summary: The vertex to be used to calculate against. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.use_curvature
member.summary: Indicates whether the earth's curvature should be taken into consideration when generating the ridgeline from a functional surface. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.use_refraction
member.summary: Indicates whether atmospheric refraction should be taken into consideration when generating the ridgeline from a functional surface. If no actual surface is specified, then checking this check box (or passing "REFRACTION" in Python) will cause silhouettes to be created instead of skylines. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.refraction_factor
member.summary: If atmospheric refraction is considered, then apply a scalar value. The default is 0.13. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Skyline.pyramid_level_resolution
member.summary: If a terrain is specified for a functional surface, then this parameter is populated with the resolutions resident in the terrain. One of the resolutions may be chosen for the purpose of generating the horizon line. The default is 0, full resolution. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier
member.summary: Generates a multipatch feature class representing a skyline barrier or shadow volume. The barrier is in a sense a surface, and looks similar to a triangle fan formed by drawing a line from the observer point to the first vertex of the skyline, then sweeping the line through all of the vertices of the skyline. A skirt and base can optionally be added to form a closed multipatch, giving the appearance of a solid. It is possible to create this closed multipatch so that it can serve as a shadow volume. If the input is a silhouette (a multipatch feature class) rather than a skyline (a polyline feature class), then the multipatch is extruded into a shadow volume.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The point feature class containing the observer point(s). (In, Required)
The input line feature class which represents the skyline(s) or the input multipatch feature class which represents the silhouette(s). (In, Required)
The output feature class into which the skyline barrier or shadow volume is placed. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.in_observer_point_features
member.summary: The point feature class containing the observer point(s). (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.in_features
member.summary: The input line feature class which represents the skyline(s) or the input multipatch feature class which represents the silhouette(s). (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.out_feature_class
member.summary: The output feature class into which the skyline barrier or shadow volume is placed. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.min_radius_value_or_field
member.summary: The minimum radius to which triangle edges should be extended from the observer point. The default is 0, meaning no minimum. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.max_radius_value_or_field
member.summary: The maximum radius to which triangle edges should be extended from the observer point. The default is 0, meaning no maximum. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.closed
member.summary: Whether to close the skyline barrier with a skirt and a base, so that the resulting multipatch will appear to be a solid. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.base_elevation
member.summary: The elevation of the base of the closed multipatch; ignored if the barrier is not to be closed. The default is 0. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.SkylineBarrier.project_to_plane
member.summary: Whether the front (nearer to the observer) and back (farther from the observer) ends of the barrier should each be projected onto a vertical plane. This is typically checked (turned on) in order to create a shadow volume. (In, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D
member.summary: Determines the distance from each feature in the input features to the nearest features in the near features, within the search radius.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The input feature class or layer containing features from which distances are calculated to each feature in the Near Features. (In, Required)

The feature class or layer containing features from which distances are calculated to the closest feature in the Input Features. If multiple feature classes or layers are specified, an extra field named NEAR_FC will be added to the input feature class to identify which near feature class contains the closest feature. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D.in_features
member.summary: The input feature class or layer containing features from which distances are calculated to each feature in the Near Features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D.near_features
member.summary: The feature class or layer containing features from which distances are calculated to the closest feature in the Input Features. If multiple feature classes or layers are specified, an extra field named NEAR_FC will be added to the input feature class to identify which near feature class contains the closest feature. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D.search_radius
member.summary: The maximum distance between Input Features and Near Features for which distance and FID will be determined. If no Search Radius is specified, all Near Features will be used. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D.location
member.summary: Determines whether six coordinate fields (two sets of x,y,z values) are added to each input feature. The values are the three coordinates of the input feature (NEAR_FROMX, NEAR_FROMY, NEAR_FROMZ), and the three coordinates of the nearest feature (NEAR_X, NEAR_Y, NEAR_Z). The fields NEAR_FID and NEAR_DIST are always added, regardless of the Location option. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D.angle
member.summary: Determines whether the angles between the input feature and the nearest near feature will be calculated, and stored into the NEAR_ANG_H and NEAR_ANG_V fields. Both angle values are in degrees, where one degree represents 1/360 of a circle, and fractions of a degree are represented as decimal points. Horizontal angles are measured from 180 to -180; 0 to the east, 90 to the north, 180 (-180) to the west, and -90 to the south. Vertical angles are zero for horizontal, 90 for straight up, and -90 for straight down. (In, Optional)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Near3D.delta
member.summary: Determines whether the distances along the primary axes between the input feature and the nearest near feature will be calculated, and stored into the NEAR_DELTX, NEAR_DELTY, and NEAR_DELTZ fields. (In, Optional)

member.summary: Output Feature Class (out, Optional)

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Inside3D
member.summary: Tests each feature to determine if it falls inside a multipatch. If it falls inside a multipatch feature, it writes an entry to a new table indicating which feature it fell within.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Inside3D.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Constructor that takes all required parameters for geoprocessor execution.
member.param: The z-enabled point, line, polygon, or multipatch features. (In, Required)
The multipatch features. The multipatches must be closed. Use the Is Closed 3D tool to determine if the multipatches are closed. (In, Required)

The output table providing a list of 3D Input Features that are inside or partially inside the Input Multipatch Features which are closed. The output table contains an OID (object ID), Target_ID, and Status. The Status will state if the input feature (Target_ID) is within or partially within a multipatch. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Inside3D.in_target_feature_class
member.summary: The z-enabled point, line, polygon, or multipatch features. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Inside3D.in_container_feature_class
member.summary: The multipatch features. The multipatches must be closed. Use the Is Closed 3D tool to determine if the multipatches are closed. (In, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Inside3D.out_table
member.summary: The output table providing a list of 3D Input Features that are inside or partially inside the Input Multipatch Features which are closed. The output table contains an OID (object ID), Target_ID, and Status. The Status will state if the input feature (Target_ID) is within or partially within a multipatch. (Out, Required)

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.Analyst3DTools.Inside3D.complex_output
member.summary: The Complex Output Table option modifies the output table to include information about the relationship between the Input Features and the Input Multipatch Features. This allows you to identify which features fell inside or partially inside specific closed multipatches. When it's checked on, then the output table will have an extra Container_ID displayed, along with the Target_ID information. This Container_ID represents the exact multipatch which the input features (Target_ID) are inside or partially. (In, Optional)
